title.narrative: Ghana: Public Financial Management Reform Project

description.narrative: The project development objective (PDO) is to improve the budget management, financial control and reporting of the Government of Ghana.

condition.narrative: The Recipient shall ensure that interim unaudited financial reports for the Project are prepared and furnished to the World Banknot later than 45 days after the end of each calendar quarter, covering the quarter, in form and substance satisfactory to theWorld Bank (Schedule 2, Section II.B.2).

The Recipient shall have its Financial Statements for the Project audited in accordance with the provisions of Section 2.07 (b) ofthe Standard Conditions. Each such audit of the Financial Statements shall cover the period of one fiscal year of the Recipient.The audited Financial Statements for each such period shall be furnished to the World Bank not later than six months after the endof such period (Schedule 2, Section II.B.3).

The Recipient shall prepare, under terms of reference satisfactory to the World Bank, and furnish to the World Bank not later thanNovember 30 in each calendar year, for the World Bank’s consideration, a proposed work plan of approved activities to be includedinthe Project for the following calendar year, such plan to include an implementation schedule and budget and financing plantherefor (Schedule 2, Section I.C.1).

The recipient shall not later than two (2) months after the end of each Fiscal Year review, approve, and publish annual progressreports on the Project , all in accordance with the provisions of the Project Implementation Manual (Schedule 2, SectionI.A.2.ii(c)).

title.narrative: Percentage of payroll subjected to annual payroll verification
Expenditure arrears as a percentage of Central Goverment budgetary expenditures
Strengthening the internal audit institution and capacity through establishment of internal audit teams in MDAs focusing on risk-based and systemic issues
Average time taken to complete external audit of MMDAs using modern audit techniques.
Percentage of Public Service staff captured on the HRMIS
GIFMIS expenditure management functionality established in MMDAs(for CF, statutory and IGFs
MDAs integrating procurement planning as part of budget preparation process

baseline.value: Lack of analytical capacity to review budgets ex ante and audit reports implementation

target.value: Published PAC reviewed audit reports within 12 months of end of year of audit.

actual.value: Published PAC reviewed audit reports within 12 months of end of year of audit.

title.narrative: Number of MDAs reporting ex-post on program performance
Percentage of Budgetary Spending Units submitting Cash forecasting plans
Number of Government Staff that have completed IPSAS Business Process Training
Percentage of Government staff who are female
Unified chart of accounts prepared to meet GFS.budget and IPSAS needs;operational policies for GFS, PIM, and budget established

baseline.value: No existence of unified chart of accounts

target.value: Evidence of the establishment of unified chart of accounts prepared to meet GFS, budget and IPSAS needs; operational policies forGFS,PIM

actual.value: No unified chart of accounts prepared to meet GFS, budget and IPSAS needs; operational policies for GFS, PIM, and budgetestablished and approved.

target.value: Evidence of 2020 balance sheet IPSAS compliant

title.narrative: Proportion of budgetary expenditures in Annual Financial Statements of CAGD(including Consolidated Funds,Stautory Funds,Internally Generated Funds and Donor Funds)processed through GIFMIS
Percentage of Central GOG Cash Cash accounts in TSA at Bank of Ghana
